citation.article-title: Selenomonas acidaminovorans sp. nov., a versatile thermophilic proton-reducing anaerobe able to grow by decarboxylation of succinate to propionate.

p.s: Description of Selenomonas acidaminovorans sp.nov.
Selenomonas acidaminovorans (a.cid.a.mi.no'vo.rans. M.l.n. acidum acid; adj. amino amino; L.v. voro to devour; M.L.part. adj. acidaminovorans devouring amino acids)
Curved cells, 2.5-3.0 x 0.5-0.6 μm with rounded ends, single or in pairs, or in long chains when grown in complex media.
Motile by lateral flagellation at the concave side.
Gram-negative, non-sporeforming.
Strictly anaerobic.
Moderately thermophilic.
Suecinate decarboxylated to propionate.
Glutamate, α-ketoglutarate, histidine, arginine, ornithine, lysine and threonine fermented to acetate and propionate.
Serine, pyruvate, alanine, glucose, fructose, xylose, glycerol and citrate fermented to acetate.
Branched-chain amino acids converted to branched-chain fatty acids.
Hydrogen is the only reduced end product.
Growth and substrate conversion are enhanced by co-cultivation with methanogens (Methanobacterium thermoautotrophicum ΔH).
Sulfate, thiosulfate, nitrate, sulfur and fumarate are not reduced.
Contains b-type cytochromes.
pH Range: 6.5-8.1.
Temperature range: 40-58°C, optimum 55°C.
DNA base ratio: 56.5±0.3 mol percent G + C (thermal denaturation).
Habitat: methanogenic granular sludge.
Type strain: Su883 (DSM 6589) deposited in Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Braunschweig, FRG.
